title: Maroon Heritage
description: The Jamaican Maroons are descendants of Africans who escaped slavery during Spanish and British colonial rule...
history: Established in the 17th and 18th centuries by escaped enslaved Africans. Maroons negotiated treaties with the British in 1739–1740, securing autonomy and land rights.

title: Jerk Cuisine
description: Jerk cooking is a fiery, flavorful tradition rooted in Maroon resistance...
history: Originated with Maroons who used pit cooking and native spices to preserve meat while evading colonial forces. Boston Bay became a hub for authentic jerk in the 20th century.

title: Rastafari Movement
description: Emerging in the 1930s, Rastafari is a spiritual and cultural movement...
history: Founded in the 1930s by figures like Leonard Howell. Inspired by Haile Selassie I’s coronation and rooted in Pan-Africanism, anti-colonial resistance, and spiritual liberation.

title: Dancehall Music
description: Dancehall evolved from reggae in the late 1970s...
history: Developed in late 1970s Kingston as a raw, urban evolution of reggae. Fueled by sound system culture, digital rhythms, and youth expression.

title: Blue Mountain Coffee
description: Grown in the misty peaks of the Blue Mountains...
history: Introduced in the 18th century by British colonists. Cultivated by small farmers and cooperatives, with strict export standards established in the 20th century.

title: Jamaican Patois
description: Jamaican Patois is a vibrant Creole language...
history: Emerged during the colonial era as enslaved Africans blended English vocabulary with African grammar. Became a symbol of cultural pride and resistance.

title: Reggae Music
description: Reggae emerged in the 1960s as a voice for the oppressed...
history: Evolved from ska and rocksteady in 1960s Kingston. Popularized globally by Bob Marley and others, with deep ties to Rastafari and social justice.

title: Jamaican Festivals
description: From Carnival to Independence Day, Jamaica’s festivals celebrate music, dance, food, and national pride...
history: Rooted in colonial emancipation celebrations, religious observances, and cultural pride. Modern festivals blend traditional rituals with global music and tourism.
